Clinical narrative

SOB and dry cough, but not much pain. Pulmonary wheeze and few bi-basal inspiratory crackles. Treated with diuretics and settled quite quickly.
During hospital stay patient is upset about a large haematoma which developed on his hand from the venflon removal - would like to complain to his solicitor.

Relevant investigations and results

CXR: Cardiomegaly, upper lobe vascular diversion. Increased interstitial markings at bases.
ECG: moderate LVF.
Pressure sore assessment score 7-9.

Measures of physical ability and cognitive function

Self-caring with hygiene. Has pain in legs so needs lots of rest.
